N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 802.1 - Background and Intent

State Regulations

The purpose of this Part is to provide a means to support the
stability and geographic distribution of substance use disorder treatment
services throughout all geographic and economic regions of the State. A
designation of vital access provider denotes the State's determination to
ensure patient access to a provider's essential services otherwise jeopardized
by the provider's payer mix or geographic isolation. Vital access providers in
the OASAS system are limited to eligible OASAS certified inpatient
rehabilitation facilities, or such other programs as may be designated by the
commissioner. Notes
